intro: Hieracium densiflorum, commonly known as the denseflower hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing a showy display of yellow petals that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
